actions.text: Reported to House from the Committee on Rules, H. Rept. 94-884.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in House.
Measure failed of passage in House, roll call #157 (165-194).

official_title: A resolution providing for the consideration of House Joint Resolution 606.  Joint resolution to call an Atlantic Convention.

summary.text: Provides that upon the adoption of this resolution it shall be in order to move that the House resolve itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union for the consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res 606) to call an Atlantic Convention. Provides that after general debate, which shall be confined to the joint resolution and shall continue not to exceed one hour, to be equally divided and controlled by the chairman and ranking minority member of the Committee on International Relations, the joint resolution shall be read for amendment under the five-minute rule. States that, at the conclusion of the consideration of the joint resolution for amendment, the Committee shall rise and report the joint resolution to the House with such amendments as may have been adopted, and the previous question shall be considered as ordered on the joint resolution and amendments thereto to final passage without intervening motion except one motion to recommit.

titles.title: A resolution providing for the consideration of House Joint Resolution 606.  Joint resolution to call an Atlantic Convention.
